reportSummary.summary: The Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Watershed Implementation Plan aims to reduce nutrient and sediment loadings to meet water quality standards for Low Dissolved Oxygen (DO)/Organic enrichment, nutrients, and support Fish and Wildlife designated uses. Targeting agricultural lands in Tippah County, the plan implements Best Management Practices (BMPs), conducts education/outreach, and monitors water quality over a three-year project period from 2012 to 2014.
reportSummary.watershedName: Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Watershed
reportSummary.planTitle: Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Watershed Implementation Plan
organizations: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District

goals.description: Reduce nutrient and sediment loading to achieve standards for Low DO/Organic enrichment and narrative standards for nutrient loading and Fish and Wildlife Support designated use.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Reduce nutrient and sediment loading, achieve standards for Low DO/Organic enrichment and narrative standards for nutrient loading, and Fish and Wildlife Support designated use

bmps.name: Streambank and Shoreline Protection
bmps.description: Protect and stabilize 2,500 feet of streambank and shoreline to reduce sediment input.

bmps.name: Grade Stabilization Structures
bmps.description: Install 12 grade stabilization structures to reduce erosion in gullies and drainage ways.

bmps.name: Pasture and Hay Land Planting
bmps.description: Plant 100 acres of pasture and hay land to reduce erosion and nutrient runoff.
bmps.sourceExcerpt: Pasture and Hay Land Planting 100 acres $200/ac $20,000

bmps.name: Water and Sediment Control Basins
bmps.description: Construct 4 water and sediment control basins to reduce sediment runoff from agricultural lands.
bmps.sourceExcerpt: Water and Sediment Control Basin 4 structures $10,000/ ea $40,000

bmps.name: Nutrient Management
bmps.description: Manage nutrients on 700 acres to reduce nutrient runoff and loading.

bmps.name: Tank/Trough
bmps.description: Install 5 tank/trough systems to provide alternate water for livestock and reduce stream access.

bmps.name: Diversions
bmps.description: Install 1,200 feet of diversions to manage runoff and reduce sediment transport.

bmps.name: Heavy Use Area Protection
bmps.description: Install 4 heavy use area protection sites to reduce sediment and nutrient export.

bmps.name: Fencing
bmps.description: Install 10,000 feet of fencing to prevent livestock access to streams and reduce sedimentation.

bmps.name: Critical Area Planting
bmps.description: Plant 100 acres in critical areas to stabilize soils and reduce runoff.

monitoring.parameter: Biological Impairment (Nutrients and Low DO/Organic Enrichment)
monitoring.method: Stress identification studies and biological sampling
locations: Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek subwatershed
monitoring.sourceExcerpt: Muddy Creek has 2 Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) documents ... biological impairment due to Nutrients and Low Dissolved Oxygen (DO)/Organic Enrichment.

thresholds.description: May-October: geometric mean ≤ 200 per 100ml (5 samples over 30 days) with ≤ 400 per 100ml more than 10% of time. November-April: geometric mean ≤ 2000 per 100ml with ≤ 4000 per 100ml more than 10% of time.

monitoring.sourceExcerpt: A fecal coliform TMDL has been developed for an evaluated water body segment of Muddy Creek, MS206E ...

implementation.description: Assist NRCS, USGS, and Tippah County SWCD, with MDEQ support, in developing the Watershed Implementation Team (WIT).
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Assist NRCS, USGS, and the Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District (SWCD), with assistance from Mississippi Department of Environmental Quality (MDEQ), in the development of a Watershed Implementation Team (WIT).

implementation.description: Develop a Watershed Implementation Plan (WIP) consistent with MDEQ guidance and WIT assistance.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Develop a Watershed Implementation Plan (WIP) consistent with MDEQ guidance and assistance from the WIT.

implementation.description: Develop and implement a watershed monitoring plan.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Assist in the development and implementation of a watershed monitoring plan for the project.

implementation.description: Conduct watershed surveys to identify priority pollutant load areas.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Determine through intensive surveys, priority areas that are contributing significant pollutant loads in the watershed.

implementation.description: Inform public, landowners, and stakeholders and secure participation commitments.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Inform the public, landowners, and other stakeholders within the project area about the project and secure commitments from priority landowners and others willing to participate in the project.

implementation.description: Develop BMP plans as approved in the WIP.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Develop plans for Best Management Practices (BMPs) in accordance with approved WIP.

implementation.description: Assist landowners/operators in BMP installation and collect pre/post soil loss and GPS data to incorporate into GIS.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Assist landowners and operators in the installation of appropriate BMPs and collect before and after soil loss and GPS coordinates each installed BMP and incorporate into a GIS format.

implementation.description: Establish demonstration farms and conduct field days/tours to educate public about BMPs.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Establish at least two (2) demonstration farms to inform the public about BMPs and provide a least two (2) informational field days/tours.

implementation.description: Develop and distribute informational fact sheets and publish articles about the project.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Develop and distribute no fewer than 1,000 fact sheets highlighting benefits and publish no fewer than 4 articles about the project.

implementation.description: Erect project roadside signs at BMP sites.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Erect no fewer than 20 project roadside signs where BMPs are installed.

implementation.description: Document site conditions with before and after photography and MDEQ inspections.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Document pre-existing site conditions and improvements by conducting before and after photo documentation. Assist MDEQ in inspections during construction.

implementation.description: Secure maintenance agreements with landowners for BMPs with a 10-year maintenance period.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Secure maintenance agreements from cooperators/landowners in accordance with MSWCC state cost-share guidelines.

implementation.description: Submit bi-annual reports and final report to MDEQ.
implementation.sourceExcerpt: Submit bi-annual reports by every September 25th and March 25th of each year showing status of tasks and start/completion dates. Submit final report to MDEQ.

outreach.description: Erect signs identifying BMP installations throughout the watershed with landowner permission; conduct field days to showcase these BMPs.
outreach.indicator: Number of field days held, BMP signs installed
partners: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District
outreach.sourceExcerpt: Signs identifying the BMPs that have been installed will be erected throughout the watershed upon permission of landowners.

outreach.description: Host a landowner meeting and at least two field days to inform and showcase BMP efforts.
outreach.indicator: Attendance at meetings/field days and BMP installation increase
partners: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District
outreach.sourceExcerpt: There will be a landowner meeting held ... two field days held to highlight the BMPs that have been installed.

outreach.description: Develop and distribute 1,000 fact sheets about watershed, BMPs installed, soil saved, and acres impacted.
outreach.schedule: Developed once BMP installation is complete
partners: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District
outreach.sourceExcerpt: A fact sheet will be developed at the end of the project ... 1,000 fact sheets will be designed and distributed.

outreach.description: Present Watershed Harmony musical puppet show promoting water quality stewardship aligned with educational standards.
outreach.sourceExcerpt: Watershed Harmony is a musical puppet performance ... promoting water quality in their communities.

outreach.description: Set up an exhibit booth at Tippah County Fair with educational materials, pictures of BMPs, and activities for children.
outreach.schedule: Three consecutive years during the fair
outreach.indicator: Number of brochures and coloring books handed out
partners: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District
outreach.sourceExcerpt: A booth will be set up at the fair ... with information available to patrons ... Sam E Soil coloring books will be given to children.

outreach.description: Design and mail flyers with water quality improvement tips to watershed residents with their water bills.
partners: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District
outreach.sourceExcerpt: A flyer will be designed and mailed out to the homes in the Bell/Muddy watershed.

outreach.description: Make presentations to civic organizations to inform about water quality and nonpoint source pollution.
partners: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District
outreach.sourceExcerpt: Presentations relating to water quality will be made to civic organizations.

outreach.description: Run radio ads on local stations five times daily for two weeks about water quality and nonpoint pollution.
outreach.indicator: Number of ads run and produced
partners: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tippah County Soil and Water Conservation District
outreach.sourceExcerpt: Radio advertisements will be run on the local radio station to inform people about water quality and nonpoint source pollution.

outreach.description: Conduct at least one Adopt-A-Stream workshop promoting watershed stewardship and education.
outreach.indicator: Number of participants and continuation of adoption activities
outreach.sourceExcerpt: Adopt-A-Stream is a program that promotes environmental stewardship through training workshops...

geographicAreas.sourceExcerpt: The Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Watershed is located in Tippah County, Mississippi ... The watershed ID number is 0601, and the Hydrologic Unit Code (HUC) code for the watershed is 08010207.

geographicAreas.watershedName: Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Subwatershed
geographicAreas.sourceExcerpt: The targeted area of this watershed is the Bell Creek-West Prong Muddy Creek Subwatershed ... approximately 19,277 acres.
